alert.note: Alert for Southern Gila Highlands, Black Range; Upper Gila River Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 6:33PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Grant County through 700 PM MDT... At 633 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Mule Creek, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brushy Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Southern Gila Highlands, Black Range; Upper Gila River Valley
